intro: Nototriche diminutiva, commonly known as the dwarf nototriche, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it is often found in mountainous areas with high biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
